metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9430 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.1, 3.0.0 to 3.0.8, and 2.6.0 to 2.6.14, the WiMax DLMAP dissector could crash. This was addressed in plugins/epan/wimax/msg_dlmap.c by validating a length field.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.2-1
libwireshark15 - 3.2.2-1
libwiretap12 - 3.2.2-1
libwsutil13 - 3.2.2-1
tshark - 3.2.2-1
wireshark - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-common - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.2-1').
